response.content:
```json
{
  "step1": "Gather 200 g dark chocolate, 150 g butter, 200 g caster sugar, 4 large eggs, 100 g plain flour, 1 tsp baking powder, pinch salt, 1 tsp vanilla, and 120 ml milk. Preheat oven to 180°C, grease a 20 cm round tin, line with parchment, and set aside.",
  "step2": "Melt chocolate and butter together over low heat, stirring until smooth. Let the mixture cool slightly. In a separate bowl, whisk eggs and sugar until pale and fluffy, then fold in vanilla. Gradually pour the chocolate blend into the egg mixture, mixing gently.",
  "step3": "Sift flour, baking powder, and salt into a bowl. Add this dry mix to the wet mixture in three portions, folding each time until just incorporated. Add milk gradually to reach a thick, smooth batter that coats the back of a spoon.",
  "step4": "Pour the batter into the prepared tin, smoothing the surface. Tap gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Bake for 25‑30 minutes, or until a skewer inserted into the center emerges clean, indicating a moist crumb and firm top.",
  "step5": "Remove the cake from the oven and cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool fully. For extra flavor, sprinkle a dusting of cocoa powder or drizzle simple chocolate glaze over the top once cooled.",
  "step6": "Slice the cake into eight equal portions, serve plain or with whipped cream and berries for a celebratory touch. Store leftover slices wrapped tightly in foil at room temperature or refrigerate for up to three days, refreshing with a splash of milk before serving."
}
```
